chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer
Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor

result.execSummary:
The defendant Chelsea M Mariani was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

miscConds.notes:
DE will complete an AODA assessment and any follow up recommended.

DE will remain absolutely sober.

Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. 

No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician. 

DE will complete Anger Management counseling.

DE will pay court costs, provide DNA/pay surcharge.

DE will have credit for 53 days in 2022CF29 if revoked.

Days credit are as follows:
21CF204-1 day
22CF29-53 days
22CF46-5 days
22CF67-6 days
22CF70-23 days

2022GF15 CONSOLIDATED INTO 2022CF29

2022GF71 CONSOLIDATED INTO 2022CF70(CASE DRI)

2022GF63 CONSOLIDATED INTO 2022CF67(CASE DRI)

Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

records.addlTxt:
2:17 PM Defendant Chelsea M Mariani appeared by video from RC Jail.  Attorney Annette M Barna in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Krave does not appear for today's hearing. Heard along with 2021CF204, 2022CF29, 2022CF46, 2022CF67, 2022CF70.  Court cannot proceed today without Atty Krave, will attempt to get this back on the calendar possibly Friday. Adj 2:19pm. 

2:32 pm Back on the record.  DE appears in person with Atty James Krave.  DA Annette Barna appears for the State of WI.  DE will enter a plea in:

2021CF204-

2022CF29-Ct 4

2022CF46-Ct 2

All other counts and cases will be DRI.

Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE advised of Constitutional Rights, Factual basis/ PC found, plea freely, knowingly, voluntarily, intelligently made, court accepts plea of G, finds DE guilty. 

21CF204, 22CF29- Recommended sentence will be for withheld sentence, 3 years probation. DE will complete an AODA assessment and any follow up recommended, DE will complete an Anger Management program, maintain absolute sobriety, pay CC, provide DNA/pay surcharge, comply with all DOC recommendations for programming.
21CF204-1 day credit
2022CF29-53 days credit
2022CF46-5 days credit
2022CF67-6 days credit
2022CF70-23 days credit.

State enters sentencing argument. Victim rights have been complied with. Sentencing argument entered by Atty Krave.  DE makes a statement to the court. Court will accept the recommended sentence, make this an order of the court.

2:17 PM Defendant Chelsea M Mariani appeared by video from RC Jail.  Attorney Annette M Barna in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Krave does not appear for today's hearing. Heard along with 2021CF204, 2022CF29, 2022CF46, 2022CF67, 2022CF70.  Court cannot proceed today without Atty Krave, will attempt to get this back on the calendar possibly Friday. Adj 2:19pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

02:36 PM Defendant Chelsea M Mariani in court with attorney James H Krave.  Defendant Chelsea M Mariani in custody.  Annette M Barna appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Chelsea M Mariani appeared by video means with Attorney.  

22CF46, 22CF70-Waive formal reading of the CC.  DE will waive PH in 22CF46, 22CF70. Court instructs on waiver of PH, DE understands waiver, Waiver knowingly, freely, voluntarily, intelligently entered, court will accept waiver of PH.  Court reviews PC, finds PC, will bind over for Trial.  

Set cases for Plea/Sentencing May 2, 2022 @ 2:00PM. Adj 2:47pm
Plea hearing on April 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
